modernize-min-max-use-initializer-list.description:
Description

Replaces nested
std::min
and
std::max
calls with an initializer list
where applicable.

For instance, consider the following code:

int
a
=
std
::
max
(
std
::
max
(
i
,
j
),
k
);

The check will transform the above code to:

int
a
=
std
::
max
({
i
,
j
,
k
});
modernize-min-max-use-initializer-list.option:
Static analysis (Clang-Tidy) options are configured via .clang-tidy file.

This rule has no specific options.
